definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: I'll take your blood count first.
The old rule barring women and poor people from the banquets in the ancestral temples has also been broken.
sentences.chinese: 女子和窮人不能進祠堂喫酒的老例，也被打破。
她總是表現得有點不守老例。

sentences.english: Establish a routine of planning your week and your day.
sentences.chinese: 擬定計劃將擬定每週和每日打看成爲例行老例。

sentences.english: I was violating one of the rules of the regime.
sentences.chinese: 我違反了這個政權的老例。

definition: old rules/example from the past/former practices
(lit.) past years' almanac/(fig.) ancient history/obsolete practice/old-fashioned principle
to offer sacrifices to the kitchen god
seeing off the kitchen god 灶神[Zao4 shen2] (traditional rite)
lit. compass and set square/fig. established standard/rule/customs/practices/fig. upright and honest/well-behaved
mixed dish of the food left over from a banquet
tip given on a happy occasion (traditional)
